intro: Paracaryum tibeticum var. schlagintweitii, commonly known as the Tibetan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It is often found growing in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
